sen.j: また、膨大な数のスケッチを『佐竹曙山写生帖』（秋田市立千秋美術館所蔵）に収めている。
sen.e: He also included his enormous numbers of sketches in "Satake Shozan Shaseicho" (at Akita Senshu Museum of Art).
An enormous amount of his sketches were dedicated in "Satake Shozan Shaseicho" (at Akita Senshu Museum of Art).
sen.cmt: changed "included" to "dedicated" for "収めている"; fixed grammar
sen.e: An enormous amount of his sketches were dedicated in "Satake Shozan Shaseicho" (at Akita Senshu Museum of Art).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ところが、安永8年（1779年）の末に、直武は突然謹慎を申し渡され、翌年5月には死去してしまった。
sen.e: However, at the end of 1779, Naotake was suddenly ordered to refrain from making public appearances and in May, the next year he died.
At the end of 1779, however, Naotake was suddenly ordered to refrain from making public appearances and died in June of the following year (安永9年5月).
sen.cmt: changed "May" to "June" in accordance with <http://maechan.net/kanreki/> and added Japanese date in parenthesis; fixed grammar
sen.e: At the end of 1779, however, Naotake was suddenly ordered to refrain from making public appearances and died in June of the following year.
sen.cmt: 安永9年5月 削除しました。

sen.j: 源内の刃傷事件との関係を指摘する説もあるが、詳細は不明である。
sen.e: Some people say that there was a relationship with the affair involving bloodshed by Gennai, but the detail is unknown.
There is an additional theory indicating an incident of bloodshed involving Gennai but the details are unknown.
sen.cmt: changed "Some people say" to "There is an additional theory"; fixed grammar
sen.e: There is an additional theory indicating an incident of bloodshed involving Gennai but the details are unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それから5年後に曙山も亡くなると、秋田蘭画は下火となり、しだいに廃れたが、同画の系統・画流は司馬江漢に受けつがれ、さらに洋風化して須賀川の亜欧堂田善にも影響をおよぼしている。
sen.e: After Shozan also died 5 years later, Akita Ranga became not very popular any longer and out of use gradually, but the lineage and style were inherited to Kokan SHIBA and westernized further and affected Denzen AODO from Sukagawa.

After Shozan died five years later, Akita Ranga lost its popularity and gradually fell out of practice. However, its lineage and style were inherited by Kokan SHIBA, becoming further westernized and also came to have an influence on Denzen AODO from Sukagawa.
sen.cmt: split into two sentences for easier reading and fixed grammar accordingly
sen.e: After Shozan died five years later, Akita Ranga lost its popularity and gradually fell out of practice; however, its lineage and style were inherited by Kokan SHIBA, becoming further westernized and also came to have an influence on Denzen AODO from Sukagawa.
sen.cmt: 一文につなげました。

sen.j: 秋田蘭画を広く世に紹介した人物として、直武と同郷の日本画家で明治末年頃から昭和初期にかけて活躍した平福百穂がいる。
sen.e: The one who brought Akita Ranga to a wide audience was Hyakusui HIRAFUKU, a Japanese-style painter from the same prefecture as Naotake and he played an active role from the end of Maiji period to the early Showa period.

The person to bring Akita Ranga to a wide audience was Hyakusui HIRAFUKU. He was a Japanese-style painter from the same prefecture as Naotake and had great success from the end of the Meiji period to the early Showa period.

sen.e: The person to bring Akita Ranga to a wide audience was Hyakusui HIRAFUKU, who was a Japanese-style painter from the same prefecture as Naotake and had great success from the end of the Meiji period to the early Showa period.
sen.cmt: 一文につなげました。

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）、百穂は『日本洋画曙光』という大型版画集のなかで秋田蘭画を紹介している。
sen.e: In 1930 Hyakusui introduced Akita Ranga in a large-paper edition of art collection book, "Nihon Yoga Shoko (dawn of Japanese and Western paintings)".
In 1930, Hyakusui introduced Akita Ranga with a large paper edition of an art collection book called "Nihon Yogo Shoko" (The Dawn of Japanese and Western Paintings).

sen.e: In 1930, Hyakusui introduced Akita Ranga with a large paper edition of an art collection book called "Nihon Yoga Shoko" (The Dawn of Japanese and Western Paintings).
sen.cmt: Yogo →Yoga に修正しました。
